column5: Just wondering about border crossing w/ it, I'm hoping that it doesn't count as a case of beer, anyone know???
NA......= don't count as beer. When they ask you how much beer you have don't include the NA in the amount you tell them.
Well for your sake I hope thats right,but A buddy of mine owned a pizza joint in Illinois and there, it was treated just as any alcoholic beverage. He could not sell it to minors.
Read the label carefully,if it say's 0.00 percent alc.,your ok but if it say's 0.5 percent alc. then it will be treated as beer.I know it sucks but that is the law!!!

I believe you are correct,the last time I had one, I am pretty sure the label says something like "contains 0.5% Alcohol" which technically still classifies it as an alcoholic beverage. You just need to drink 12 of them to get the same alcohol content as 1 regular beer. Maybe customs will allow you 12 cases. Could be that if it says 0.0% it would be considered an illegal substance! (or should be). Rather go the other route with a short cut.. How bout some Shlitz Malt Liquor???!! Maybe customs only lets 3/4 of a case of that over the border at a time???

Actually, not all NAs have alcohol in them. Some are -0- %. In the event your NA beer has any alcohol in it, it is considered beer (an alcholic beverage) at the border. I just took a case across and had this same conversation with the Canadian boarder official.
